alert.note: Alert for Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 6:37PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Light to possibly moderate snow. Accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in the Lander Foothills and Rattlesnake Range. The south end of the Wind River Range could see 3 to 6 inches of snow. Up to one inch of snow for Riverton, Dubois, and Shoshoni. North to northeast wind gusting 20 to 30 mph will lead to blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Fremont County, the east slope of the Wind River Range, and the Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Ranges. * WHEN...1 AM to 12 PM Thursday. The heaviest snow is likely to fall between 2 AM and 9 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on roadways will be impacted by winter driving conditions and lowered visibility at times late tonight into Thursday morning. Blowing and drifting snow will occur. This includes Wyoming Highway 28 around Red Canyon and over South Pass, and US 287 from Lander to Fort Washakie.

area.areaDesc: Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
